intro: Thymelaea tinctoria, commonly known as the dyer's thymelaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its historical use in dyeing fabrics, it has cultural and traditional significance in some regions.
